page.title: 14Churches.
page.content: The parish church of St. Margaret which stands in the grounds of Buxted Park was very likely built on the site of a much earlier church in 1250 A.D. The name is in honour of Margaret Queen of Scotland (1045_1093) the wife of Malcolm the King. The style of architecture is known as Early English and the church has been little altered since it was built. Since Buxted is a relatively small village it seems surprising that this church is so large. It is because it was the Mother Church of an area which included High Hurstwood, Hadlow Down, Uckfield and Crowborough. These areas now make up seven parishes.
